channel.title: Web3 Security Paper Digest
channel.description: Curated papers on Web3, blockchain, and smart contract security from ArXiv and ACL

item.title: TxRay: Agentic Postmortem of Live Blockchain Attacks
item.description:
Summary

  • Presents TxRay, an LLM-driven agentic system that, from one or more seed transactions, reconstructs DeFi Anyone-Can-Take (ACT) exploits, derives evidence-backed root causes, and generates runnable, self-contained Proofs of Concept (PoCs).
  • Encodes incident-specific semantic oracles as executable assertions so PoCs deterministically reproduce incidents and self-check correctness.
  • Evaluates on 114 real incidents (DeFiHackLabs): TxRay produced expert-aligned root causes and executable PoCs for 105 incidents (92.11% end-to-end reproduction) and outperformed prior tools in attacker-address generalization and coverage.
  • Includes PoCEvaluator, an independent agentic execution-and-review evaluator, and demonstrates live deployment with median latencies of ~40 minutes for root causes and ~59 minutes for PoCs.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Ziyue Wang', 'Jiangshan Yu', 'Kaihua Qin', 'Dawn Song', 'Arthur Gervais', 'Liyi Zhou']
  • Tags: ['DeFi exploits', 'smart contract security', 'exploit postmortem / root cause analysis', 'PoC generation & verification', 'LLM-assisted security tooling']

item.title: Giving AI Agents Access to Cryptocurrency and Smart Contracts Creates New Vectors of AI Harm
item.description:
Summary

  • Position paper arguing that giving AI agents access to cryptocurrencies and smart contracts creates novel vectors of AI-enabled harm.
  • Analyzes unique properties of crypto and smart contracts that amplify risks (automation, composability, irreversible value transfer, programmable finance).
  • Provides a first-of-its-kind taxonomy of these new AI harm vectors and discusses examples/attack scenarios.
  • Calls for targeted technical research to prevent and mitigate these threats before widespread deployment.

Paper Type

  • Position

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Bill Marino', 'Ari Juels']
  • Tags: ['smart contract security', 'AI safety', 'crypto-asset misuse', 'DeFi/financial attacks']
